classDefinition: A long-term care facility which is used to provide care for people with disabilities or for adults who cannot or who choose not to live independently.
parentDefinition: A residential building which is used to provides long-term care for residents.

classDefinition: A long-term care facility which is used to provide care for people with complex health needs, and which typically has at least one caregiver in attendance twenty four hours a day.
parentDefinition: A residential building which is used to provides long-term care for residents.

classDefinition: A market which is used for the sale and purchase of perishable goods.
parentDefinition: A part of an ecosystem where people gather for the purchase and sale of provisions, livestock, and other goods.
parentComment: As with campgrounds and fairgrounds, land use is the key differentia here. The regularity of marketplace activities may provide a differentia for further growth of this branch.

classDefinition: A market which is used for the sale and purchase of durable goods.
parentDefinition: A part of an ecosystem where people gather for the purchase and sale of provisions, livestock, and other goods.
parentComment: As with campgrounds and fairgrounds, land use is the key differentia here. The regularity of marketplace activities may provide a differentia for further growth of this branch.

classDefinition: An institutional building which is used to provide policing services.
parentDefinition: A building which is used by an organization which serves a long-established role in human society.
parentComment: This term needs further consideration and development as semantics of institution are ambiguous at scale - e.g. are hotels institutional buildings?

classDefinition: A human construction which contains one or more polling stations
parentDefinition: A construction that has been assembled by deliberate human effort.

classDefinition: A human construction which is that part of a polling place where voters cast their ballot
parentDefinition: A construction that has been assembled by deliberate human effort.

classDefinition: A booth which enables a voter to vote confidentially.
parentDefinition: A human construction which is an enclosure or compartment designed for service provision.
parentComment: "an enclosure or compartment that allows privacy or seclusion, for example when voting, broadcasting or recording sound, or making a phone call." OED I like this one more - except it doesn't fit "ticket booth", "gas station booth" etc.

classDefinition: A human construction which is an enclosure or compartment designed for service provision.
parentDefinition: A construction that has been assembled by deliberate human effort.
classComment: "an enclosure or compartment that allows privacy or seclusion, for example when voting, broadcasting or recording sound, or making a phone call." OED I like this one more - except it doesn't fit "ticket booth", "gas station booth" etc.

classDefinition: A prison facility which is owned and operated by a private corporation.
parentDefinition: A human construction which is used to forcibly confine humans.

classDefinition: A commercial building in which the majority of commerical activity occurs in shops occupying parts of the building.
parentDefinition: A building which is primarily used to facilitate the buying or selling of goods or services.
parentComment: "Commerce includes legal, economic, political, social, cultural and technological systems that are in operation in any country or internationally."

classDefinition: A shopping center in which a large indoor pedestrian promenade provides access to stores and other facilities.
parentDefinition: A commercial building in which the majority of commerical activity occurs in shops occupying parts of the building.

classDefinition: A manufactured product consisting of a duct opening which allows air to circulate.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A poll which is attached to the head, foot, or side of a bed frame.
parentDefinition: A solid, cylindrical object or column with its length greater than its diameter.
parentComment: This was created in response to a user request, but it is an odd class in that it specifies a shape rather than a particular material entity. It may, therefore, be deprecated when more meaningful or sensible alternatives become apparent.

classDefinition: A manufactured product consisting of a panel on which control or monitoring instruments are set.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A manufactured product consisting of a handle used to open or close a door.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A pole which provides stability or support when grasped by the hand.
parentDefinition: A solid, cylindrical object or column with its length greater than its diameter.
parentComment: This was created in response to a user request, but it is an odd class in that it specifies a shape rather than a particular material entity. It may, therefore, be deprecated when more meaningful or sensible alternatives become apparent.

classDefinition: A switch which turns a light on or off.
parentDefinition: A device which can connect, disconnect, or divert current in an electrical circuit.

classDefinition: A device which can connect, disconnect, or divert current in an electrical circuit.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A manufactured product which is a storage compartment with a lock.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A switch which allows patients in health care settings to alert a nurse or other health care staff member.
parentDefinition: A device which can connect, disconnect, or divert current in an electrical circuit.

classDefinition: Steel which is composed primarily of a corrosion resistant alloy of iron and chromium.
parentDefinition: A manufactured product which is an alloy of iron and which typically contains a few tenths of a percent of carbon.

classDefinition: A manufactured product which is an alloy of iron and which typically contains a few tenths of a percent of carbon.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A paper product which is thin translucent paper.
parentDefinition: A product which is composed primarily of paper.
classComment: Tissue paper is often used for wrapping or for protecting delicate articles.

classDefinition: A plumbing fixture which is bowl-shaped, part of a toilet fixture, and capable of contain human waste until it is disposed of.
parentDefinition: An exchangeable device which can be connected to a plumbing system to deliver and drain water.

classDefinition: A manufactured product which is composed of one or more glass or other transparent or semi-transparent materials set inside a frame, and installed in wall, door, roof or vehicle surfaces to allow the passage of light, and sometimes air.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A manufactured product which is composed of a hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier which is installed at the entrance to a building, room, vehicle, or in the framework of a cabinet.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A restaurant which is of French cultural origin and which has a short menu and limited seating space.
parentDefinition: A building within which food and drink are prepared and served to customers in exchange for money or other goods and/or services.

classDefinition: A type of restaurant which is of French cultural origin and which provides more service or food variety than a bistro.
parentDefinition: A building within which food and drink are prepared and served to customers in exchange for money or other goods and/or services.

classDefinition: A restaurant which provides customers with cooked meat freshly sliced to order.
parentDefinition: A building within which food and drink are prepared and served to customers in exchange for money or other goods and/or services.

classDefinition: A restaurant which primarily serves coffee.
parentDefinition: A building within which food and drink are prepared and served to customers in exchange for money or other goods and/or services.

classDefinition: A restaurant which is small, inexpensive, and typically specializing in fried foods and/or home-cooked meals.
parentDefinition: A building within which food and drink are prepared and served to customers in exchange for money or other goods and/or services.

classDefinition: A restaurant which specializes in serving steaks and pork chops.
parentDefinition: A building within which food and drink are prepared and served to customers in exchange for money or other goods and/or services.

classDefinition: A restaurant which is of Italian cultural origin and which is generally less formal than an Italian ristorante, but more formal than an osteria.
parentDefinition: A building within which food and drink are prepared and served to customers in exchange for money or other goods and/or services.

classDefinition: A healthcare facility which is a temporary hospital or mobile medical unit that takes care of casualties on-site before they can be safely transported to more permanent facilities.
parentDefinition: A human construction in which healthcare is provided.

classDefinition: A healthcare facility which provides palliative care for the terminally ill.
parentDefinition: A human construction in which healthcare is provided.

classDefinition: A commercial building which contains auditoria for viewing films.
parentDefinition: A building which is primarily used to facilitate the buying or selling of goods or services.
parentComment: "Commerce includes legal, economic, political, social, cultural and technological systems that are in operation in any country or internationally."

classDefinition: An industrial building which is used to store goods.
parentDefinition: An industrial building is a building within which goods are produced and, optionally, stored or within which services are rendered.
parentComment: It's possible that this will become an inferred class in the future. The United Nations' International Standard Industrial Classification should be referred to when expanding this branch. ISIC can also be used to identify processes. See http://unstats.un.org/unsd/cr/registry/regcst.asp?Cl=27&Lg=1.

classDefinition: An office building which is the chief administrative building of a city, town, or other municipality.
parentDefinition: A commercial building which contains parts used as workplaces primarily for administrative and managerial workers.
parentComment: "An office building will be divided into sections for different companies or may be dedicated to one company. In either case, each company will typically have a reception area, one or several meeting rooms, singular or open-plan offices, as well as toilets."

classDefinition: A public building or site which provides facilities used by people to keep fit or relax.
parentDefinition: A permanent walled and roofed construction.

classDefinition: An area of developed space which is reserved for office buildings.
parentDefinition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily covered by constructed or manufactured objects and materials, possibly interspersed with cultivated or anthropically maintained vegetation.

classDefinition: A terrestrial environmental zone where wild animals live safely or are hunted in a controlled way for sport.
parentDefinition: An environmental zone which is bounded by material parts of a land mass or the atmosphere or space adjacent to it.

classDefinition: A hill which is small and usually separated from a larger group of hills such as a range.
parentDefinition: A rounded elevation of limited extent rising above the surrounding land with local relief of less than 300m.
classComment: Hillocks are similar in their distribution and size to small mesas or buttes.

classDefinition: A shore along a river.
parentDefinition: That part of the land in immediate contact with a body of water including the area between high and low water lines.

classDefinition: An island which is small, principally composed of rock, and usually too small for human habitation.
parentDefinition: Area of dry or relatively dry land surrounded by water or low wetland.

classDefinition: A power plant which is a group of wind turbines in the same location used to produce electricity.
parentDefinition: A power plant is a building which contains one or more generators which convert mechanical energy into electrical energy through the relative motion between a magnetic field and a conductor. The energy source harnessed to turn the generator varies widely.

classDefinition: An island that is not permanently populated by humans.
parentDefinition: Area of dry or relatively dry land surrounded by water or low wetland.

classDefinition: A store which is physically large and is part of a retail chain.
parentDefinition: A building in which a business presents a selection of goods and offers to trade or sell them to customers for money or other goods.

classDefinition: A bridge which is a truss bridge, pre-fabricated, and portable.
parentDefinition: A built structure erected over a depression or obstacle to carry traffic or some facility such as a pipeline.

classDefinition: A bridge which is hinged and can be raised.
parentDefinition: A built structure erected over a depression or obstacle to carry traffic or some facility such as a pipeline.

classDefinition: A bridge designed solely for pedestrians.
parentDefinition: A built structure erected over a depression or obstacle to carry traffic or some facility such as a pipeline.

classDefinition: A bridge which arches in the center, and has a span which is higher than the ramps on either side, forming a hump-like arrangement.
parentDefinition: A built structure erected over a depression or obstacle to carry traffic or some facility such as a pipeline.

classDefinition: A bridge which is used for transportaiton, and which crosses over another road or railway.
parentDefinition: A built structure erected over a depression or obstacle to carry traffic or some facility such as a pipeline.

classDefinition: A bridge which has its deck hung on vertical suspenders via suspension cables.
parentDefinition: A built structure erected over a depression or obstacle to carry traffic or some facility such as a pipeline.

classDefinition: A bridge which is movable and has a vertical locating pin as its primary structural support, and a support ring about which it can pivot horizontally.
parentDefinition: A built structure erected over a depression or obstacle to carry traffic or some facility such as a pipeline.

classDefinition: A device that causes suction in order to remove debris from surfaces.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: Poultry manure made of chicken feces.
parentDefinition: Manure which is composed primarily of the feces of poultry.

classDefinition: A soft sulfate mineral composed of calcium sulfate dihydrate.
parentDefinition: Anthropogenic material in or on which organisms may live.

classDefinition: A container for storing water.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: An anthropogenic geographic feature consisting of a receptacle intended to provide drinking water to animals.
parentDefinition: An anthropogenic geographic feature is a geographic feature resulting from the influence of human beings on nature.

classDefinition: A paper product which is a thin sheet material made of processed cellulose fibres.
parentDefinition: A product which is composed primarily of paper.

classDefinition: An agricultural building used for crop storage or animal husbandry.
parentDefinition: A permanent walled and roofed construction.

classDefinition: An animal house where fowl are kept.
parentDefinition: A house used for sheltering non-human animals.
parentComment: While humans are animals, this class does not refer to human houses.

classDefinition: Environmental material consisting of waste products that have been discarded at an unsuitable location.
parentDefinition: A material entity which other material entities in an environmental system are primarily or partially composed of.
parentComment: Everything under this parent must be a mass noun (i.e. not countable). All subclasses are to be understood as being composed primarily of the named entity, rather than restricted to that entity. For example, "ENVO:water" is to be understood as "environmental material composed primarly of some CHEBI:water".

classDefinition: Environmental material consisting of waste products that have been discarded at an unsuitable location.
parentDefinition: A material entity which other material entities in an environmental system are primarily or partially composed of.
parentComment: Instances of this class are portions of environmental materials, such as seawater in bucket, a water parcel in the photic zone of a lake, or the concrete that composes a building part. Instances of these portions may have fiat or non-fiat boundaries. For example, a water parcel has not physical boundaries, while the seawater in a bucket is bounded by the internal surfaces of the bucket.

classDefinition: A manufactured product consisting of a table or desk used for sewing.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A manufactured product consisting of a  disk-shaped material that rotates around an axle bearing placed through a hole in its center.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A manufactured product consisting of a  shallow platform designed for the carrying of items.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A tool with a flat, smooth rubber blade, used to remove or control the flow of liquid on a flat surface.
parentDefinition: A manufactured product which has been designed to 1) allow a human to do work more efficiently and 2) be used in a hand-held fashion.

classDefinition: An indoor toilet that is available for public use.
parentDefinition: An indoor toilet is a room which contains a sanitation fixture used primarily for the disposal of human urine and faeces.

classDefinition: A device that moves fluids (liquids or gases), or sometimes slurries, by mechanical action.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A hand tool used to remove the outer layer of vegetables and fruit, consisting of a handle attached to a metal blade with a slot with a sharp edge.
parentDefinition: A manufactured product which has been designed to 1) allow a human to do work more efficiently and 2) be used in a hand-held fashion.

classDefinition: A manufactured product which is a flat transport structure that supports goods in a stable fashion while being lifted and/or moved.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A device used in packaging operations.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A building or room that is part of a cathedral, monastery or collegiate church, in which larger meetings are held.
parentDefinition: A permanent walled and roofed construction.

classDefinition: A building which is at the center of Islam's most important mosque, the Great Mosque of Mecca.
parentDefinition: A permanent walled and roofed construction.

classDefinition: A building which is a place of worship for Muslims.
parentDefinition: A permanent walled and roofed construction.

classDefinition: A building that has been placed on one of the four statutory lists maintained by Historic England in England, Historic Environment Scotland in Scotland, Cadw in Wales, and the Northern Ireland Environment Agency in Northern Ireland.
parentDefinition: A permanent walled and roofed construction.

classDefinition: A residential building containing bunks or beds which are often not separated by walls.
parentDefinition: A human house which serves as a long-term shelter for its inhabitants and within which they store personal property.
parentComment: This term is not to be used for hotels, hostels, inns and the like, which provides shorter-term stays.

classDefinition: A commercial building where merchants trade grains.
parentDefinition: A building which is primarily used to facilitate the buying or selling of goods or services.
parentComment: "Commerce includes legal, economic, political, social, cultural and technological systems that are in operation in any country or internationally."

classDefinition: A commercial building designed for kilning (drying) hops.
parentDefinition: A building which is primarily used to facilitate the buying or selling of goods or services.
parentComment: "Commerce includes legal, economic, political, social, cultural and technological systems that are in operation in any country or internationally."

classDefinition: A building that formed a very large fruit tree green house, or conservatory, on the grounds of fashionable residences from the 17th to the 19th centuries.
parentDefinition: A permanent walled and roofed construction.

classDefinition: A building which historically has at least 10 floors.
parentDefinition: A permanent walled and roofed construction.

classDefinition: A residential building shared by multiple dwellings, typically with flats or apartments on each floor and with shared entrance stairway access.
parentDefinition: A human house which serves as a long-term shelter for its inhabitants and within which they store personal property.
parentComment: This term is not to be used for hotels, hostels, inns and the like, which provides shorter-term stays.

classDefinition: A public building constructed as a external, free-standing monument enclosing the interment space or burial chamber of a deceased person or people.
parentDefinition: A permanent walled and roofed construction.

classDefinition: A sports facility where bowling is played.
parentDefinition: A building or region where sports activities can be carried out.

classDefinition: A transport feature consisting of a closed building structure to hold aircraft or spacecraft.
parentDefinition: A construction which enables the movement of humans, their animals or their vehicles.

classDefinition: A device consisting of a continuous flexible band moved by a series of rollers to transport objects or material from one place to another.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A manufactured product which is 1) an endless belt of flexible material stretched between two drums; 2) conveys material between drum locations.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A device designed to remove water or humidity.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A dryer that is used to remove moisture from textiles.
parentDefinition: A device designed to remove water or humidity.

classDefinition: A cow shed for baby cows/bulls.
parentDefinition: An animal house which is used to shelter cows.

classDefinition: An animal house used for housing livestock.
parentDefinition: A house used for sheltering non-human animals.
parentComment: While humans are animals, this class does not refer to human houses.

classDefinition: A hand tool for making rotational adjustments.
parentDefinition: A manufactured product which has been designed to 1) allow a human to do work more efficiently and 2) be used in a hand-held fashion.

classDefinition: A self-service shop offering a wide variety of food, beverages and household products, organized into sections.
parentDefinition: A shop in which a business offers food products for sale or trade.
parentComment: Whether food is the primary product offered by the business or simply one of the products it offers is not specified in this class.

classDefinition: A part of an oven or a small stove used to broil food.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A portable, box-type industrial storage product used for the storage and handling or parts and materials, that may collapse to conserve space when not in use.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A large bag with parallel handles that emerge from the sides of its pouch.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A factory where raw or preprocessed materials are transformed into finished parts or products.
parentDefinition: A factory (previously manufactory) or manufacturing plant is an industrial site, usually consisting of buildings and machinery, or more commonly a complex having several buildings, where workers manufacture goods or operate machines processing one product into another.

classDefinition: A factory where raw materials are treated or prepared for final processing.
parentDefinition: A factory (previously manufactory) or manufacturing plant is an industrial site, usually consisting of buildings and machinery, or more commonly a complex having several buildings, where workers manufacture goods or operate machines processing one product into another.

classDefinition: A factory for processing, packaging, labelling, handling, and storing cheese.
parentDefinition: A factory where raw materials are treated or prepared for final processing.

classDefinition: A processing plant for slaughtering, processing, packaging, labelling, handling, and storing of food animal carcasses, parts of carcasses, and meat products.
parentDefinition: A factory where raw materials are treated or prepared for final processing.

classDefinition: A bandage wrap used on the lower legs of a horse.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.
classComment: A stable bandage runs from just below the knee or hock, to the bottom of the fetlock joint, and protects the cannon bone, tendons of the lower leg, and fetlock joint.

classDefinition: A delicatessen which prepares and sells preserved meat products.
parentDefinition: A food shop which sells a selection of food products that are not typical dietary components of the human population it is co-located with.
parentComment: The food products sold in a delicatessen are often considered unusual by the majority of its customers and may come from foreign food supplies which are not widely imported into its region of operation.

classDefinition: A building part consisting of a board covering the joint between the lowest part of an interior wall surface and the floor.
parentDefinition: A building part is a construction which is part of a building.
classComment: Its purpose is to cover the joint between the wall surface and the floor.
parentComment: Not recommended for annotation. This class is likely to be made into an inferred class as its subclasses are distributed among more meaningful superclasses (i.e. ceiling is_a surface layer). See for example, "building floor". The boundaries between building parts may be bona fide or fiat.

classDefinition: Plant matter consisting of an impermeable buoyant material, the phellem layer of bark tissue.
parentDefinition: Organic material which is primarily composed of plant structures, living or dead.

classDefinition: Macromolecules that are obtained naturally from plants or animals.
parentDefinition: A material entity which other material entities in an environmental system are primarily or partially composed of.
parentComment: Everything under this parent must be a mass noun (i.e. not countable). All subclasses are to be understood as being composed primarily of the named entity, rather than restricted to that entity. For example, "ENVO:water" is to be understood as "environmental material composed primarly of some CHEBI:water".

classDefinition: Macromolecules that are obtained naturally from plants or animals.
parentDefinition: A material entity which other material entities in an environmental system are primarily or partially composed of.
parentComment: Instances of this class are portions of environmental materials, such as seawater in bucket, a water parcel in the photic zone of a lake, or the concrete that composes a building part. Instances of these portions may have fiat or non-fiat boundaries. For example, a water parcel has not physical boundaries, while the seawater in a bucket is bounded by the internal surfaces of the bucket.

classDefinition: A thin, transparent sheet made of regenerated cellulose.
parentDefinition: Environmental material derived from living organisms and composed primarily of one or more biomacromolecules.
classComment: Cellophane is used for food packaging.

classDefinition: Synthetic plastic which is composed of a glossy, moistureproof membrane made of rubber hydrochloride.
parentDefinition: A plastic which is composed primarily of polymers produced by a manufacturing process.

classDefinition: A polyester film made from stretched polyethylene terephthalate (PET).
parentDefinition: A material entity which other material entities in an environmental system are primarily or partially composed of.
parentComment: Everything under this parent must be a mass noun (i.e. not countable). All subclasses are to be understood as being composed primarily of the named entity, rather than restricted to that entity. For example, "ENVO:water" is to be understood as "environmental material composed primarly of some CHEBI:water".

classDefinition: A polyester film made from stretched polyethylene terephthalate (PET).
parentDefinition: A material entity which other material entities in an environmental system are primarily or partially composed of.
parentComment: Instances of this class are portions of environmental materials, such as seawater in bucket, a water parcel in the photic zone of a lake, or the concrete that composes a building part. Instances of these portions may have fiat or non-fiat boundaries. For example, a water parcel has not physical boundaries, while the seawater in a bucket is bounded by the internal surfaces of the bucket.

classDefinition: A solid environmental material that is hard, brittle, heat-resistant and corrosion-resistant, made by shaping and then firing a nonmetallic mineral at a high temperature.
parentDefinition: An environmental material which is in a solid state.
parentComment: This is a defined class: its subclasses will not be asserted, but filled by inference.

classDefinition: An environmental system where environmental monitoring processes are in effect.
parentDefinition: A system which has the disposition to environ one or more material entities.
parentComment: In ENVO's alignment with the Basic Formal Ontology, this class is being considered as a subclass of a proposed BFO class "system". The relation "environed_by" is also under development. Roughly, a system which includes a material entity (at least partially) within its site and causally influences that entity may be considered to environ it. Following the completion of this alignment, this class' definition and the definitions of its subclasses will be revised.

classDefinition: An environmental monitoring area which is under observation by humans belonging to organisations with a legislative mandate to monitor the area.
parentDefinition: An environmental system where environmental monitoring processes are in effect.

classDefinition: An environmental monitoring program area within a food production facility.
parentDefinition: An environmental monitoring area which is under observation by humans belonging to organisations with a legislative mandate to monitor the area.

classDefinition: An object aggregate which comprises objects whose surfaces are in contact with food during its processing in a food production facility
classComment: This can be axiomatised with "'has part' min 1 'food contact surface'" . This can also have the axiom "'part of' some 'food production environmental monitoring zone'"

classDefinition: An object aggregate which comprises objects whose surfaces are not in contact with food during its processing, but which are in close proximity to those in food production environmental monitoring zone 1.
classComment: This can be axiomatised with "'has part' min 1 'food contact surface'" . This can also have the axiom "'part of' some 'food production environmental monitoring zone'". The threshold for "close proximity" can vary based on local or national legislation. 'adjacent to' axioms may also be used for neighbouring zones.

classDefinition: An object aggregate which comprises a facility's set of more remote non-food-processing-contact surfaces that are in or near the processing areas (food productions environmental monitoring zones 1 and 2) and could lead to their contamination, especially through human movement.
classComment: This can be axiomatised with "'has part' min 1 'food contact surface'" . This can also have the axiom "'part of' some 'food production environmental monitoring zone'". The threshold for "close proximity" can vary based on local or national legislation. 'adjacent to' axioms may also be used for neighbouring zones.

classDefinition: An object aggregate which comprises objects in proximity to food production environmental monitoring zone 3.
classComment: This can be axiomatised with "'has part' min 1 'food contact surface'" . This can also have the axiom "'part of' some 'food production environmental monitoring zone'". The threshold for "close proximity" can vary based on local or national legislation. 'adjacent to' axioms may also be used for neighbouring zones.

classDefinition: An environmental system which is part of a food production facility and whose boundaries are defined by hygienic requirements.
parentDefinition: A system which has the disposition to environ one or more material entities.
classComment: This class is more a convenience grouping class, but can be axiomatised if a hygienic assessment process is completed.
parentComment: In ENVO's alignment with the Basic Formal Ontology, this class is being considered as a subclass of a proposed BFO class "system". The relation "environed_by" is also under development. Roughly, a system which includes a material entity (at least partially) within its site and causally influences that entity may be considered to environ it. Following the completion of this alignment, this class' definition and the definitions of its subclasses will be revised.

classDefinition: A hygienic food production area which is not an immediate part of a food manufacturing process area.
parentDefinition: An environmental system which is part of a food production facility and whose boundaries are defined by hygienic requirements.
parentComment: This class is more a convenience grouping class, but can be axiomatised if a hygienic assessment process is completed.

classDefinition: A hygienic food production area containing products having a low risk of contamination.
parentDefinition: An environmental system which is part of a food production facility and whose boundaries are defined by hygienic requirements.
classComment: This class includes manufacturing areas in which raw materials and/or finished products (within their primary packaging) and packaging/labeling materials are received, sampled, or stored prior to dispatch.
parentComment: This class is more a convenience grouping class, but can be axiomatised if a hygienic assessment process is completed.

classDefinition: A hygienic food production area in which general food processing occurs.
parentDefinition: An environmental system which is part of a food production facility and whose boundaries are defined by hygienic requirements.
classComment: This class includes areas in which raw materials are received, sorted, and sampled; areas within the plant where products susceptible to contamination and/or microbial growth are processed, treated, or handled; areas in which animal carcasses are cut into fresh meat products and areas in which vegetables and produce are packed. Food processing that prepares products for cooking by the consumer (e.g., raw meats, fish, and vegetables) or produces RTE products that are effectively preserved (e.g., canned or baked products) will require procesing in medium-risk hygiene areas.
parentComment: This class is more a convenience grouping class, but can be axiomatised if a hygienic assessment process is completed.

classDefinition: A hygienic food production area containing food products that are not subjected to subsequent microbial decontamination, and where there is a risk of pathogen or microbial spoilage growth.
parentDefinition: An environmental system which is part of a food production facility and whose boundaries are defined by hygienic requirements.
parentComment: This class is more a convenience grouping class, but can be axiomatised if a hygienic assessment process is completed.

classDefinition: An anthropogenic environment which provides long-term shelter for its inhabitants.
parentDefinition: An anthropogenic environment is an environmental system which is the product of human activity.
parentComment: Unsatisfactory definition here. Must consider the threshold that makes an environmental system anthropogenic.

classDefinition: A stable dispersion (emulsion) of polymer microparticles in an aqueous medium.
parentDefinition: Anthropogenic material in or on which organisms may live.
classComment: Latex is made by some plants, but synthetic latexes can be manufactured as well.

classDefinition: A container which is typically made of glass or plastic and having a tapered neck, used primarily for holding liquids.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A hand tool for domestic use, especially in the kitchen.
parentDefinition: A manufactured product which has been designed to 1) allow a human to do work more efficiently and 2) be used in a hand-held fashion.

classDefinition: An eating utensil with spikes used to put solid food into the mouth, or to hold food down while cutting.
parentDefinition: A utensil used for consuming food.

classDefinition: A utensil used for consuming food.
parentDefinition: A hand tool for domestic use, especially in the kitchen.

classDefinition: An eating utensil with a scooped end and a long handle.
parentDefinition: A utensil used for consuming food.

classDefinition: A utensil which is a hand-sized container with an open top.
parentDefinition: A hand tool for domestic use, especially in the kitchen.
classComment: A cup may be used to hold liquids for pouring or drinking, or to store solids for pouring.

classDefinition: An anthropogenic environment which is bounded by a healthcare facility in which health care services are provided by specialized staff and equipment.
parentDefinition: An anthropogenic environment is an environmental system which is the product of human activity.
parentComment: Unsatisfactory definition here. Must consider the threshold that makes an environmental system anthropogenic.

classDefinition: An anthropogenic environment which is the product of a particular human occupational acitivity.
parentDefinition: An anthropogenic environment is an environmental system which is the product of human activity.
parentComment: Unsatisfactory definition here. Must consider the threshold that makes an environmental system anthropogenic.

classDefinition: An anthropogenic environment which is designed for child care.
parentDefinition: An anthropogenic environment is an environmental system which is the product of human activity.
parentComment: Unsatisfactory definition here. Must consider the threshold that makes an environmental system anthropogenic.

classDefinition: A human construction in which child care services are provided to a human child by specialized staff and equipment.
parentDefinition: A construction that has been assembled by deliberate human effort.

classDefinition: A child care facility in which day care services are provided, by specialized staff and equipment, to a human child during the working day.
parentDefinition: A construction that has been assembled by deliberate human effort.

classDefinition: A human construction in which individuals or a group of people such as a congregation come to perform acts of devotion, veneration, or religious study.
parentDefinition: A construction that has been assembled by deliberate human effort.

classDefinition: A building reserved in which religious or spiritual rituals and activities such as prayer and sacrifice are performed.
parentDefinition: A permanent walled and roofed construction.
classComment: "The term typically used for such buildings belonging to all faiths where a more specific term such as church, mosque or synagogue is not generally used in English." [Wikipedia]

classDefinition: A child care facility in which child care services are provided to young children and babies.
parentDefinition: A human construction in which child care services are provided to a human child by specialized staff and equipment.

classDefinition: An anthropogenic environment which is bounded by a human dwelling.
parentDefinition: An anthropogenic environment is an environmental system which is the product of human activity.
parentComment: Unsatisfactory definition here. Must consider the threshold that makes an environmental system anthropogenic.

classDefinition: A public building in which health, recreation or other public services to a local community are provided.
parentDefinition: A permanent walled and roofed construction.

classDefinition: A healthcare facility which is used by a group of general practitioners and nurses to provide healthcare services to people in a certain area.
parentDefinition: A human construction in which healthcare is provided.

classDefinition: A room which contains 1) a number of beds for sleeping and 2) often some other furniture and/or residential utilities.
parentDefinition: A building part which is separated from other building parts by one or more interior walls and, optionally, outdoor areas by one or more exterior walls.
classComment: A dormitory is often used to describe student and backpacker accommodation of this kind.

classDefinition: A political entity which is defined by contract between the Canadian state ("the Crown") and a First Nations people.
parentDefinition: A geographical region whose affairs and population are administered by an authority.
classComment: "[First Nations reserves] are not to be confused with land claims areas, which involve all of that First Nations' traditional lands: a much larger territory than any other reserve." [Wikipedia]

classDefinition: A human dwelling which may be unsustainable over the long term for an inhabitant because of financial, livability, overcrowding or other factors.
parentDefinition: A self-contained constructed feature used by one or more households as a home, such as a house, apartment, mobile home, houseboat or other 'substantial' structure. A dwelling typically includes nearby outbuildings, sheds etc. within the curtilage of the property, excluding any 'open fields beyond'. It has significance in relation to search and seizure, conveyancing of real property, burglary, trespass, and land use planning.

classDefinition: A human dwelling which is provided to one or more persons on a short-term basis.
parentDefinition: A self-contained constructed feature used by one or more households as a home, such as a house, apartment, mobile home, houseboat or other 'substantial' structure. A dwelling typically includes nearby outbuildings, sheds etc. within the curtilage of the property, excluding any 'open fields beyond'. It has significance in relation to search and seizure, conveyancing of real property, burglary, trespass, and land use planning.

classDefinition: An eating utensil which is a thin stick used in equal length pairs to manipulate food and bring it into a mouth.
parentDefinition: A utensil used for consuming food.

classDefinition: A building which 1) containing multiple dwellings of pre-furnished accomodation and 2) is rented on a short term and/or longer-term basis.
parentDefinition: A permanent walled and roofed construction.

classDefinition: A healthcare facility which is used to provide healthcare services to animals.
parentDefinition: A human construction in which healthcare is provided.

classDefinition: An aircraft which 1) has fixed wings and 2) is propelled by a thrust from a jet engine, propeller, or rocket engine.
parentDefinition: A vehicle which is able to travel through air in an atmosphere.

classDefinition: A healthcare facility which is the office of a physician.
parentDefinition: A human construction in which healthcare is provided.

classDefinition: A constructed transport system which is designed to transport people or objects over land, but not water or air.
parentDefinition: A system which has components that have been constructed to allow the movement of people or goods.

classDefinition: An animal house which houses stray, lost, abandoned or surrendered animals.
parentDefinition: A house used for sheltering non-human animals.
classComment: An animal rescue shelter typically houses mostly dogs and cats.
parentComment: While humans are animals, this class does not refer to human houses.

classDefinition: A prison facility which is owned by the state and operated by a private corporation.
parentDefinition: A human construction which is used to forcibly confine humans.

classDefinition: A system which is composed of one or more machines that can continuously transport material from one location to at least one other location.
parentDefinition: A material entity consisting of multiple components that are causally integrated.

classDefinition: A manufactured product which is capable of some manufacturing process.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A system which consists of manufacturing equipment that performs manufacturing processes in a linear fashion.
parentDefinition: A material entity consisting of multiple components that are causally integrated.

classDefinition: A manufactured product which is a structural system on which equipment components are mounted.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A manufactured product which positions a piece of equipment above a surface.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A conveyor system which uses conveyer belt machines to transport material.
parentDefinition: A system which is composed of one or more machines that can continuously transport material from one location to at least one other location.

classDefinition: A manufacturing equipment piece which is used to package material.
parentDefinition: A manufactured product which is capable of some manufacturing process.

classDefinition: A conveyor system which is used to transport granular material vertically in open containers.
parentDefinition: A system which is composed of one or more machines that can continuously transport material from one location to at least one other location.

classDefinition: A conveyor system which consists of a helicoid flight mounted in a tube or shaft.
parentDefinition: A system which is composed of one or more machines that can continuously transport material from one location to at least one other location.

classDefinition: A conveyor system which transports dry bulk particulate or granular material through a pipeline by a stream of gas.
parentDefinition: A system which is composed of one or more machines that can continuously transport material from one location to at least one other location.

classDefinition: A manufactured product which is a cylindrical (or approximately cylindrical) item used under a heavy object to facilitate moving it.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.
classComment: Usually several conveyor rollers are organized in a linear fashion to convey an object between locations.

classDefinition: An interface layer which is formed where either two parts of a material entity or two separate material entities touch or are attached to one another along some length.
parentDefinition: A layer which separates two portions of environmental material which possess 1) differing compositions, 2) a discontinuity of some property, or 3) some derivative of some property in a direction normal to the interface.

classDefinition: A liquid water which has no current or flow and is susceptible to contamination by pathogens or pathogenic vectors.
parentDefinition: An environmental material primarily composed of dihydrogen oxide in its liquid form.

classDefinition: Dust which is 1) generated when wood is processed and 2) composed primarily of cellulose, polyoses, and lignin.
parentDefinition: Particulate environmental material with diameters less than 500 micrometers.
classComment: Wood dust is typically generated through processes where wood is chipped, sawed, turned, drilled or sanded. The chemical composition of wood dust depends on the species of tree. Wood dust is not typically produced for specific uses. However, it is used commercially for wood composts. The primary routes of potential human exposure to wood dust are inhalation and dermal contact. It is known to be a human carcinogen.
parentComment: Dust occurs in and may be deposited from the atmosphere.

classDefinition: A hydraulic fluid which is 1) used in hydraulic brake and hydraulic clutch applications in vehicles to amplify braking force and 2) composed primarily of ethylene glycol, polyglycols, silicone fluids, and isobutyl alcohol.
parentDefinition: A medium by which power is transferred in hydraulic machinery.
parentComment: Common hydraulic fluids are based on mineral oil or water.

classDefinition: A medium by which power is transferred in hydraulic machinery.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.
classComment: Common hydraulic fluids are based on mineral oil or water.

classDefinition: Fluid used for valve operation, brake band friction, and gear lubrication within an automatic vehicle transmission.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: An environmental system process during which populations have reduced access to food, causing increased hunger, malnutrition, and consequent mortality.
parentDefinition: A process in which includes the components of an environmental system as participants.
parentComment: This is a convenience class for organisation and should not be used for annotation.

classDefinition: A lubricant for internal combustion engines which 1) reduces friction and wear 2) cleans the engine 3) neutralizes acids 4) improves sealing of piston rings, and 5) cools the engine.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A liquid fuel used in diesel engines, whose fuel ignition takes place, without any spark, as a result of compression of the inlet air mixture and then injection of fuel.
parentDefinition: A naturally occurring flammable liquid consisting of a complex mixture of hydrocarbons of various molecular weights and other liquid organic compounds, that are found in geologic formations beneath the planetary surfaces.

classDefinition: A clear petroleum-derived flammable liquid which is used as fuel in most spark-ignited internal combustion engines.
parentDefinition: A naturally occurring flammable liquid consisting of a complex mixture of hydrocarbons of various molecular weights and other liquid organic compounds, that are found in geologic formations beneath the planetary surfaces.
classComment: Gasoline consists mostly of organic compounds obtained by the fractional distillation of petroleum, enhanced with a variety of additives.

classDefinition: A gas which results from the incomplete or complete combustion of diesel fuel.
parentDefinition: A material entity which is composed of one or more chemical entities and has neither independent shape nor volume but tends to expand indefinitely.

classDefinition: A gas which results from the complete or incomplete combustion of gasoline fuel.
parentDefinition: A material entity which is composed of one or more chemical entities and has neither independent shape nor volume but tends to expand indefinitely.

classDefinition: A coloured substance that chemically bonds to the substrate to which it is being applied
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: Pigments carried by solvents or water which are applied to leather to be absorbed into the pores of the leather to deposit coloration.
parentDefinition: A coloured substance that chemically bonds to the substrate to which it is being applied

classDefinition: Dyes used for the coloration or brightening of paper.
parentDefinition: A coloured substance that chemically bonds to the substrate to which it is being applied

classDefinition: Dyes utilized for coloring textiles such as wool or cellulose fibers.
parentDefinition: A coloured substance that chemically bonds to the substrate to which it is being applied
classComment: Textile dyes may include acid dyes, substantive dyes, mordant dues, sulfur dyes, azoic dyes, and disperse dyes.

classDefinition: A black or colored ink which is 1) used for writing, printing, and drawing and 2) made from fine soot (lampblack) and water.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A polysaccharide that functions as an emulsifier, stabilizer, and thickener in mixtures.
parentDefinition: A material entity which other material entities in an environmental system are primarily or partially composed of.
parentComment: Everything under this parent must be a mass noun (i.e. not countable). All subclasses are to be understood as being composed primarily of the named entity, rather than restricted to that entity. For example, "ENVO:water" is to be understood as "environmental material composed primarly of some CHEBI:water".

classDefinition: A polysaccharide that functions as an emulsifier, stabilizer, and thickener in mixtures.
parentDefinition: A material entity which other material entities in an environmental system are primarily or partially composed of.
parentComment: Instances of this class are portions of environmental materials, such as seawater in bucket, a water parcel in the photic zone of a lake, or the concrete that composes a building part. Instances of these portions may have fiat or non-fiat boundaries. For example, a water parcel has not physical boundaries, while the seawater in a bucket is bounded by the internal surfaces of the bucket.

classDefinition: A naturally occurring plant-based gum, which functions as a viscous, odorless, tasteless, water-soluble mixture of polysaccharides that absorbs water to become a gel/paste.
parentDefinition: A material entity which other material entities in an environmental system are primarily or partially composed of.
classComment: Tragacanth has many uses, including as an emulsifier, thickener, stabilizer, and texturant additive for foods, pharmaceuticals, and art materials.

classDefinition: A paint product which adheres to surfaces and forms a binding layer, preparing it to receive paint.
parentDefinition: Any liquid, liquefiable, or mastic composition that, after application to a substrate in a thin layer, converts to a solid film. It is most commonly used to protect, color, or provide texture to objects.

classDefinition: A smooth, durable vitreous coating which is made by fusing powdered glass to a substrate.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.
classComment: Enamel can be used on metal, glass, ceramics, stone, or any material able to withstand the fusing temperature. Enamel is made by 1) firing, melting the powder and 2) allowing allowing it to flow across a surface to then harden.

classDefinition: A slow-drying paint that consists of particles of pigment suspended in a drying oil, commonly linseed oil.
parentDefinition: Any liquid, liquefiable, or mastic composition that, after application to a substrate in a thin layer, converts to a solid film. It is most commonly used to protect, color, or provide texture to objects.

classDefinition: A flammable liquid hydrocarbon mixture produced from natural gas condensates, petroleum distillates, and the distillation of coal tar and peat.

classDefinition: Dust which is composed of minerals and trace elements, generated by  finely crushed rock.

parentComment: Dust occurs in and may be deposited from the atmosphere.

For example, "ENVO:water" is to be understood as "environmental material composed primarly of some CHEBI:water".

classDefinition: An environmental material which is composed primarily of gases and particles produced by the combustion of petroleum fuels.
parentDefinition: A material entity which other material entities in an environmental system are primarily or partially composed of.
parentComment: Instances of this class are portions of environmental materials, such as seawater in bucket, a water parcel in the photic zone of a lake, or the concrete that composes a building part. Instances of these portions may have fiat or non-fiat boundaries. For example, a water parcel has not physical boundaries, while the seawater in a bucket is bounded by the internal surfaces of the bucket.

classDefinition: Waste which contains toxic components (e.g., heavy metals or radiation) which can cause harm to organisms and/or the environment.
parentDefinition: A material which is not the desired output of a process and which is typically the input of a process which removes it from its producer (e.g. a disposal process).

classDefinition: A part of a cloud.
parentDefinition: A part of an astronomical body which is composed of a continuous medium bearing liquid, gaseous, and solid material in variable quantities.

classDefinition: A building part which is maintained such that the number of foreign particulates within it is controlled.
parentDefinition: A building part is a construction which is part of a building.
classComment:
The cleanliness level of a cleanroom is quantified by the number of particles per cubic meter at a predetermined molecule measure.

Cleanrooms are designed to maintain extremely low levels of particulates, such as dust, airborne organisms, or vaporized particles. Cleanroons are used in the manufacture of pharmaceutical items, integrated circuits, CRT, LCD, OLED and microLED displays.
parentComment: Not recommended for annotation. This class is likely to be made into an inferred class as its subclasses are distributed among more meaningful superclasses (i.e. ceiling is_a surface layer). See for example, "building floor". The boundaries between building parts may be bona fide or fiat.

classDefinition: Sediment which contains some chemical contaminant.
parentDefinition: Sediment which has increased levels of one or more chemical compounds.

classDefinition: Liquid water which is a participant in a water cooling process.
parentDefinition: An environmental material primarily composed of dihydrogen oxide in its liquid form.
classComment: Cooling water is commonly used for cooling automobile internal combustion engines and power stations.

classDefinition: A pipeline network which is used to transport drinking water to consumers.
parentDefinition: A human construction which is used to transport a material which is primarily composed of liquid or gas through a system of pipes.
parentComment: Pipeline networks typically materials either from 1) a production area to a market area for consumption, 2) a production area to an area for waste disposal.

classDefinition: A human construction which is used to transport a material which is primarily composed of liquid or gas through a system of pipes.
parentDefinition: A construction that has been assembled by deliberate human effort.
classComment: Pipeline networks typically materials either from 1) a production area to a market area for consumption, 2) a production area to an area for waste disposal.

classDefinition: An industrial building in which water undergoes a purification process to make it fit for human consumption.
parentDefinition: An industrial building is a building within which goods are produced and, optionally, stored or within which services are rendered.
parentComment: It's possible that this will become an inferred class in the future. The United Nations' International Standard Industrial Classification should be referred to when expanding this branch. ISIC can also be used to identify processes. See http://unstats.un.org/unsd/cr/registry/regcst.asp?Cl=27&Lg=1.

classDefinition: A manufactured product which is capable of connecting or disconnecting the conducting path in an electrical circuit, interrupting the electric current or diverting it from one conductor to another.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

classDefinition: A waste material which is primarily composed of uneaten food and removed from the food supply chain.
parentDefinition: A material which is not the desired output of a process and which is typically the input of a process which removes it from its producer (e.g. a disposal process).
classComment: The causes of food waste or loss are numerous and can occur during production, processing, distribution, retail and consumption.

classDefinition: A fluid environmental material which is contained in geologic formations naturally.
parentDefinition: An environmental material which is unable to resist shear forces and continuously deforms when subject to them.

classDefinition: A building part which has been constructed to support the provision of intensive care medicine to patients with severe or life-threatening illnesses and injuries.
parentDefinition: A building part is a construction which is part of a building.
parentComment: Not recommended for annotation. This class is likely to be made into an inferred class as its subclasses are distributed among more meaningful superclasses (i.e. ceiling is_a surface layer). See for example, "building floor". The boundaries between building parts may be bona fide or fiat.

classDefinition: Liquid water which occurs naturally within the pores of rocks and sediments.
parentDefinition: An environmental material primarily composed of dihydrogen oxide in its liquid form.

classDefinition: A bioreactor which has a membrane as a part
parentDefinition: A biomaterial containment unit which is capable of 1) containing a mass of environmental material which hosts an active collection of organisms and 2) maintaining conditions which are conducive to one or more metabolic activities of the organisms it contains.
classComment: It is widely used for municipal and industrial wastewater treatment. The membrane is usually used to perform microfiltration, ultrafiltration or osmosis, etc.

classDefinition: A soil horizon which is primarily composed of mineral material.
parentDefinition: A layer which is primarily composed of some solid material, allowing for non-solid parts such as interstitial pockets of gas or liquid.
classComment: Usually less than 20% organic carbon. The term mineral horizon refers to surface soil/topsoil and subsoil layer of the soil. When user does not/could not refer to the topsoil or subsoil specifically, the broader term, mineral horizon can be used.

classDefinition: A soil horizon which is primarily composed of mineral material.
parentDefinition: A soil layer which is parallel to the soil surface and which has roughly homogenous physical, chemical and biological properties relative to the soil layers above or beneath it.
classComment: Usually less than 20% organic carbon. The term mineral horizon refers to surface soil/topsoil and subsoil layer of the soil. When user does not/could not refer to the topsoil or subsoil specifically, the broader term, mineral horizon can be used.

classDefinition: A soil layer which is parallel to the soil surface and which has roughly homogenous physical, chemical and biological properties relative to the soil layers above or beneath it.
parentDefinition: A layer that is composed primarily of soil.

classDefinition: A pipeline network which is used to transport oil to consumers.
parentDefinition: A human construction which is used to transport a material which is primarily composed of liquid or gas through a system of pipes.
parentComment: Pipeline networks typically materials either from 1) a production area to a market area for consumption, 2) a production area to an area for waste disposal.

classDefinition: An environmental material which consists of either loose sands or partially consolidated sandstone, containing a naturally occurring mixture of sand, clay, and water, soaked with a dense and extremely viscous form of petroleum.
parentDefinition: A material entity which other material entities in an environmental system are primarily or partially composed of.
parentComment: Everything under this parent must be a mass noun (i.e. not countable). All subclasses are to be understood as being composed primarily of the named entity, rather than restricted to that entity. For example, "ENVO:water" is to be understood as "environmental material composed primarly of some CHEBI:water".

classDefinition: An environmental material which consists of either loose sands or partially consolidated sandstone, containing a naturally occurring mixture of sand, clay, and water, soaked with a dense and extremely viscous form of petroleum.
parentDefinition: A material entity which other material entities in an environmental system are primarily or partially composed of.
parentComment: Instances of this class are portions of environmental materials, such as seawater in bucket, a water parcel in the photic zone of a lake, or the concrete that composes a building part. Instances of these portions may have fiat or non-fiat boundaries. For example, a water parcel has not physical boundaries, while the seawater in a bucket is bounded by the internal surfaces of the bucket.

classDefinition: A river which has elevated levels of contaminants.
parentDefinition: A stream which, through permanent or seasonal flow processes, moves from elevated land towards lower elevations through a definite channel and empties either into a sea, lake, or another river or ends on land as bed seepage and evapotranspiration exceed water supply.
classComment: The contaminants may cause adverse changes in the ecosystems associated with it.
parentComment: "There are no official definitions for the generic term river as applied to geographic features, although in some countries or communities a stream is defined by its size. Many names for small rivers are specific to geographic location; examples are "run" in some parts of the United States, "burn" in Scotland and northeast England, and "beck" in northern England. Sometimes a river is defined as being larger than a creek, but not always: the language is vague."

classDefinition: Rock which is derived from bedrock through chemical weathering
parentDefinition: A rock is a naturally occurring solid aggregate of one or more minerals or mineraloids.
parentComment: From https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ [A mineral] is different from a rock, which can be an aggregate of minerals or non-minerals and does not have a specific chemical composition. The exact definition of a mineral is under debate, especially with respect to the requirement a valid species be abiogenic, and to a lesser extent with regards to it having an ordered atomic structure.

classDefinition: An environmental material which is composed of insoluble solid particles suspended in a liquid.
parentDefinition: A material entity which other material entities in an environmental system are primarily or partially composed of.
parentComment: Everything under this parent must be a mass noun (i.e. not countable). All subclasses are to be understood as being composed primarily of the named entity, rather than restricted to that entity. For example, "ENVO:water" is to be understood as "environmental material composed primarly of some CHEBI:water".

classDefinition: An environmental material which is composed of insoluble solid particles suspended in a liquid.
parentDefinition: A material entity which other material entities in an environmental system are primarily or partially composed of.
parentComment: Instances of this class are portions of environmental materials, such as seawater in bucket, a water parcel in the photic zone of a lake, or the concrete that composes a building part. Instances of these portions may have fiat or non-fiat boundaries. For example, a water parcel has not physical boundaries, while the seawater in a bucket is bounded by the internal surfaces of the bucket.

classDefinition: A soil horizon which is composed primarily of organic matter.
parentDefinition: A soil layer which is parallel to the soil surface and which has roughly homogenous physical, chemical and biological properties relative to the soil layers above or beneath it.
classComment: The organic matter is this layer is genreally derived from biomatter.

classDefinition: Vinasse which is produced during the rectification and distillation of ethanol from sugar cane.
parentDefinition: A manufactured product which is formed as a liquid byproduct generated during the rectification and distillation of ethanol.
parentComment: Vinasse is produced by the sugar or ethanol industry and can be produced at volumes as high as 20-fold of ethanol. It is typically sulfur-rich, low pH, dark-colored and odorous.

classDefinition: A manufactured product which is formed as a liquid byproduct generated during the rectification and distillation of ethanol.
parentDefinition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.
classComment: Vinasse is produced by the sugar or ethanol industry and can be produced at volumes as high as 20-fold of ethanol. It is typically sulfur-rich, low pH, dark-colored and odorous.

classDefinition: An earth-filled dam which is used for the storage of mining operations byproducts, after separating the ore from the gangue.
parentDefinition: An embankment dam which is primarily composed of compacted earth.

classDefinition: An embankment dam which is primarily composed of compacted earth.
parentDefinition: A dam which is created by the placement and compaction of a complex semi-plastic mound of various compositions of soil, sand, clay, or rock.

classDefinition: A human construction which is used as a storage area for mining tailings.
parentDefinition: A construction that has been assembled by deliberate human effort.

classDefinition: A layer that is composed primarily of soil.
parentDefinition: A material entity which 1) is spatially continuous, 2) is composed of material of comparable thickness, composition, and physical properties, and 3) is physically distinct from adjacent portions of environmental material.

classDefinition: A dam which is created by the placement and compaction of a complex semi-plastic mound of various compositions of soil, sand, clay, or rock.
parentDefinition: A barrier constructed across a watercourse to control the flow or raise the level of water.

classDefinition: A yard which consists of land immediately adjacent to the back of a residential building
parentDefinition: An anthropogenic geographic feature which consists of land immediately adjacent to a building or a group of buildings.

classDefinition: An anthropogenic geographic feature which consists of land immediately adjacent to a building or a group of buildings.
parentDefinition: An anthropogenic geographic feature is a geographic feature resulting from the influence of human beings on nature.

classDefinition: An island which is small, low in elevation, sandy, and located on the surface of a coral reef.
parentDefinition: Area of dry or relatively dry land surrounded by water or low wetland.

classDefinition: A room which is maintained at lower than ambient temperatures.
parentDefinition: A building part which is separated from other building parts by one or more interior walls and, optionally, outdoor areas by one or more exterior walls.
classComment: Cold rooms are generally used as walk-in storage facilities or to perform tasks requiring cooler ambient temperatures.

classDefinition: Soil which has properties that restrict a pathogen's ability to establish itself, persist, or cause disease that results in long-term harm.
parentDefinition: An environmental material which is primarily composed of minerals, varying proportions of sand, silt, and clay, organic material such as humus, interstitial gases, liquids, and a broad range of resident micro- and macroorganisms.
classComment: The pathogenicity that is suppressed is typically directed towards plants, especially crops. Soils are typically classified as pathogen-suppressive if a pathogen 1) cannot establish itself or persist, 2) is able to establish itself, but causes little or no damage, or 3) is able to establishe itself, but only causes disease that does not result in long-term harm.
parentComment:
'In engineering terms, soil is referred to as regolith, or loose rock material that lies above the 'solid geology'. Soil is commonly referred to as "earth" or "dirt"; technically, the term "dirt" should be restricted to displaced soil.' https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soil

" The upper limit of soil is the boundary between soil and air, shallow water, live plants, or plant materials that have not begun to decompose. Areas are not considered to have soil if the surface is permanently covered by water too deep (typically more than 2.5 meters) for the growth of rooted plants.

The lower boundary that separates soil from the nonsoil underneath is most difficult to define. Soil consists of horizons near the Earth's surface that, in contrast to the underlying parent material, have been altered by the interactions of climate, relief, and living organisms over time. Commonly, soil grades at its lower boundary to hard rock or to earthy materials virtually devoid of animals, roots, or other marks of biological activity. For purposes of classification, the lower boundary of soil is arbitrarily set at 200 cm."  Soil taxonomy, 2nd Ed., quoted in http://www.nrcs.usda.gov/wps/portal/nrcs/detail/soils/edu/?cid=nrcs142p2_054280

classDefinition: A pond which has nutrient-rich water.
parentDefinition: A body of water, usually of smaller size than a lake.

classDefinition: A forest ecosystem which is designated for research.
parentDefinition: An ecosystem which is determined by communities of plants with a tree growth form and in which members of those communities form continuous or discontinuous regions of canopy cover.
parentComment: The definitions of forest can vary greatly, and different classes will be needed to support the major categories. Tree cover alone is not enough to distinguish between forests and plantations. The international definition proposed by the 2010 FAO Forestry Resource Assessment: "land spanning more than 0.5 ha with trees higher than 5 metres and canopy cover of more than 10 percent, or trees able to reach these thresholds in situ . It does not include land that is predominantly under agricultural or urban land use." - FAO.  2010. Global forest resources assessment 2010, Main report, FAO Forestry Paper 163. Rome.

classDefinition: A pit which has been constructed for use in fermentation processes that will yield alcoholic spirits.
parentDefinition: A construction that has been assembled by deliberate human effort.

classDefinition: A pit which has been constructed for use in fermentation processes that will yield alcoholic spirits.
parentDefinition: A depression in the ground resembling a hole or cavity, either natural or anthropogenic.

classDefinition: A manufactured product which assists starting a fermentation process which is intended to prepare foods and alcoholic drinks.
